channel.title: Need to change IP address of server.java
channel.description: Is there any way of changing the ip address to where i can use my webhost to host the server on. If you can help me I would appreciate this so much. I have ran many servers and no one has had a problem. But with more bandwidth capability i would like to use my webhost :p. Please help me. Thanks

item.title: Need to change IP address of server.java
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

andrew01292:

Errm crap man i have 75 gb of bandwidth and 10 gb of memory but yeah I am new to to Java so IDK and I need a walkthrough if you would that would be nice. It’s nice to see people actually help one here. Hopefully you can help me with this!

It probably has Java already, at SSH type java -version and/or javac -version

Read full topic

item.title: Need to change IP address of server.java
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

If you have 128mb or more memory then yes it’s possible. Make sure the server has Java, if it doesn’t, install it.
Then just upload your files, and simply run your server like you would before… not the batch way… java -Xmx512m server

Read full topic

item.title: Need to change IP address of server.java
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

You can’t host servers on a free or paid webhost unless it’s a VPS or Dedicated server offering Shell (SSH) access.

Read full topic
